intro: Lindsaea roxasii, commonly known as the Philippine mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from the host while performing photosynthesis. The plant has a delicate, vine-like structure with small, ovate leaves and produces inconspicuous flowers followed by berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to habitat loss, Lindsaea roxasii is considered a rare and endangered species.
